alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area; Lower Columbia; South Willamette Valley; Western Columbia River Gorge (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 13 at 1:40PM PST until February 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of a dusting to 1 inch, except 1 to 3 inches above 500 feet. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oregon and southwest Washington. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Accumulations will vary considerably below 1000 feet, with most areas seeing less than a half inch of snow accumulation. Isolated, heavier snow showers will produce localized snow accumulations of 1 inch or more, especially for elevations above 500 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area; Lower Columbia; South Willamette Valley; Western Columbia River Gorge
